slides.title: Welcome to ACCA FM
slides.content:
# Financial Management (FM)

FM covers **corporate finance** decisions for businesses.

## What You Will Learn

- **Working Capital** - Day-to-day finance
- **Investment Appraisal** - Capital decisions
- **Business Finance** - Sources of funds
- **Risk Management** - Hedging strategies

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Financial objectives | 10% |
| Working capital | 20% |
| Investment decisions | 30% |
| Business finance | 20% |
| Risk management | 20% |

slides.title: Working Capital Management
slides.content:
# Working Capital

## Definition

```
Current Assets - Current Liabilities
= Net Working Capital
```

## Working Capital Cycle

```
Inventory days
+ Receivable days
- Payable days
= Cash operating cycle
```

## Policies

| Policy | Risk | Return |
|--------|------|--------|
| Aggressive | Higher | Higher |
| Conservative | Lower | Lower |
| Moderate | Medium | Medium |

## Overtrading

- Growing too fast
- Insufficient working capital
- Cash crisis risk

slides.title: Inventory Management
slides.content:
# Inventory Control

## EOQ Model

```
EOQ = sqrt(2 x D x Co / Ch)

D = Annual demand
Co = Ordering cost
Ch = Holding cost
```

## Reorder Level

```
Reorder level = Demand x Lead time

With buffer stock:
= (Maximum demand x Maximum lead time)
```

## JIT (Just in Time)

| Advantage | Disadvantage |
|-----------|-------------|
| Low inventory cost | Delivery risk |
| Less waste | Supplier dependent |
| Quality focus | Setup time |

slides.title: Receivables Management
slides.content:
# Credit Management

## Credit Policy Components

| Component | Options |
|-----------|--------|
| Credit period | Days allowed |
| Cash discount | Early payment incentive |
| Credit limit | Maximum exposure |
| Collection | Procedures |

## Evaluating Discount

```
Cost of discount:

d / (1-d) x 365 / (T-t)

d = discount %
T = normal credit days
t = discount period
```

## Credit Assessment

- References
- Credit agencies
- Financial analysis
- Credit scoring

slides.title: Cash Management
slides.content:
# Cash Flow Management

## Motives for Holding Cash

| Motive | Reason |
|--------|--------|
| Transactions | Daily needs |
| Precautionary | Unexpected needs |
| Speculative | Opportunities |

## Cash Budget

```
Opening balance
+ Receipts
- Payments
= Closing balance
```

## Baumol Model

```
Optimal cash = sqrt(2 x T x F / r)

T = Total cash needed
F = Transaction cost
r = Interest rate
```

## Miller-Orr Model

- Upper and lower limits
- Return point
- Daily fluctuation

slides.title: Investment Appraisal
slides.content:
# Capital Investment

## Appraisal Methods

| Method | Basis |
|--------|-------|
| Payback | Time to recover |
| ARR | Average return |
| NPV | Present value |
| IRR | Return rate |

## NPV Calculation

```
NPV = Sum of PV of cash flows
    = Sum( CF / (1+r)^n ) - Initial cost

NPV > 0: Accept
NPV < 0: Reject
```

## IRR

```
Rate where NPV = 0

IRR > Cost of capital: Accept
IRR < Cost of capital: Reject
```

slides.title: Relevant Cash Flows
slides.content:
# Cash Flow Identification

## Include

| Item | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| Incremental cash | Include |
| Opportunity cost | Include |
| Working capital | Include |
| Tax effects | Include |

## Exclude

| Item | Why |
|------|-----|
| Sunk costs | Already incurred |
| Allocated overheads | Not incremental |
| Financing costs | In discount rate |
| Depreciation | Not cash |

## Working Capital

```
Investment at start
Released at project end
```

slides.title: Cost of Capital
slides.content:
# Cost of Capital

## Cost of Equity (CAPM)

```
Ke = Rf + beta(Rm - Rf)

Rf = Risk-free rate
beta = Systematic risk
Rm = Market return
```

## Cost of Debt

```
Kd = Interest rate x (1 - Tax rate)
```

## WACC

```
WACC = (E/V x Ke) + (D/V x Kd)

E = Equity value
D = Debt value
V = Total value
```

## When to Use WACC

- Similar risk project
- Same capital structure
- Marginal investment

slides.title: Sources of Finance
slides.content:
# Business Finance

## Equity Sources

| Source | Features |
|--------|----------|
| Ordinary shares | Voting, dividends |
| Preference shares | Fixed dividend |
| Retained earnings | No issue costs |

## Debt Sources

| Source | Features |
|--------|----------|
| Bank loan | Interest, security |
| Bonds | Fixed term |
| Lease | Asset finance |
| Overdraft | Flexible |

## Pecking Order

```
1. Retained earnings (first)
2. Debt
3. New equity (last)
```

slides.title: Gearing
slides.content:
# Capital Structure

## Gearing Ratio

```
Debt / Equity x 100

or

Debt / (Debt + Equity) x 100
```

## Effect of Gearing

| High Gearing | Low Gearing |
|--------------|-------------|
| Higher risk | Lower risk |
| Tax benefit | Less tax shield |
| Fixed charges | Flexible |

## Interest Cover

```
PBIT / Interest expense

Measures ability to pay interest
```

## Optimal Structure

- Trade-off theory
- Tax benefits vs distress costs
- Industry norms

slides.title: Foreign Exchange
slides.content:
# Currency Risk

## Types of Exposure

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Transaction | Specific transactions |
| Translation | Consolidation |
| Economic | Competitiveness |

## Hedging Methods

| Method | Mechanism |
|--------|----------|
| Forward contract | Lock in rate |
| Money market | Borrow/deposit |
| Options | Right, not obligation |
| Futures | Exchange-traded |

## Forward Rate

```
Forward rate = Spot x (1 + foreign rate) / (1 + domestic rate)
```

slides.title: Interest Rate Risk
slides.content:
# Managing Interest Rates

## Exposure

- Variable rate debt
- Floating rate investments

## Hedging Tools

| Tool | Description |
|------|-------------|
| FRA | Forward rate agreement |
| Interest rate swap | Exchange payments |
| Interest rate options | Caps, floors, collars |

## Swap

```
Company A: Fixed rate
Company B: Variable rate

Swap: A pays variable, B pays fixed
```

## Duration

Measure of interest rate sensitivity.
